text:
<@U07MAGZJL0Y>

How about setting up an example with everything you need, and then save it as a Section.

This way other editors can just add the saved section with all the content setup as per your preferred example
I don't understand what you mean.

If you create a page and set up af rich text module and fill in the details that you want per default. E.g.

• Header
• Subheader
• Text paragraphs including bullet list
• etc.
Then the interface has an option to save what you just made as a Section that other editors can grab from a saved section list.

Ah, I see. That's an interesting feature and might be useful later, but I don't think it helps with what exactly I'm trying to do here. Unless there's some way to reference a saved section programmatically and have it inserted by default into a template.
